sub_title: Release manager bij ABN AMRO Bank N.V.

awards.title: 2nd place Innovation Challenge APM Terminals
awards.description: Loosing finalist in the Innovation Challenge organized for APM Terminals by ECE Students. During an entire day filled with fun and engaging activities - brainstorming sessions and pitching battles - we developed innovative, creative solutions for their latest container terminal that was recently opened at the 2de Maasvlakte. We looked at how we could increase productivity, decrease (human) failures, lower the energy consumption, and reduce operational costs.

awards.title: 2nd place Social Entrepreneurship Masterclass
awards.description: Together with my co-founder, Gloria Marin, I participated in a month-long accelerator program in which students take their ideas for social entrepreneurship and develop them into an early-stage startup. A total of 12 teams participated. We want to launch Chip In, a donation platform, that enables people in the region of Rotterdam to support a local charity from just one euro a month, and they can cancel their donations at any time. We will stand out from the rest by using gamification.

certifications.name: Bachelor of Science International Business Administration (IBA)
certifications.authority: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

organizations.name: Erasmus Centre for Entrepreneurship Students (ECE Students)

projects.title: Rabobank/ACE Entrepreneurship Summerschool
projects.description: During this 5-day course, Experts from Rabobank Amsterdam, the Amsterdam Center for Entrepreneurship (ACE) and successful entrepreneurs helped us, and 24 other participants, with starting up or further developing our company. Besides creating a business-plan, we trained our entrepreneurial skills, built up a network and followed workshops about finance, marketing, sustainable entrepreneurship, sales and strategy.

contributors.headline: Release manager bij ABN AMRO Bank N.V.

profile_positions.description:
Employed as Release Manager for ABN Amro at the IT International headquarters. There I coordinate for 13 Scrum Teams for the T24 (Core Banking) Application on different levels the software changes that are logically grouped into a Release.

- I ensure that software being changed remains traceable (properly administrated in our Life Cycle Management Tooling) and that only correct, tested, and authorized versions are promoted through our Release street.

- I am responsible for facilitating communication to all relevant stakeholders (Delivery Teams, RUN, Countries, etc.) whenever changes are made to the Release Calendar & when there's (un)planned downtime to the develop/test environments

Some of these changes on both infra- and/or application level can include: The introduction of a new Payments Module for country "X" so that transactions are processed faster. The roll-out of a new Database for country "Y" so that query performance is improved for all end-users. Or migrating the IT (Private Banking) landscape of country "Z" from an older system to a newer, standardized platform.
profile_positions.title: Release Manager

profile_positions.description:
At the HQ in The Hague I wrote a report which examines from an IT perspective how the professions of the future will evolve in Royal Dutch Shell by the year 2025, using a ‘People, Process, and Technology’ framework. For the scope of this research, a closer look was given to the Global Functions departments such as Legal, Finance, HR, and Real Estate. The findings from this research were used as a guideline for the digital transformation that the company needs to embark on, in order to stay ahead of the competition and geared towards the future.

I created the report by making use of a variety of different sources: Internal Shell documents, Gartner reports, and presentations; the book called: “The future of the professions: How technology will transform the work of human experts”, written by Daniel and Richard Susskind; Academic literature retrieved from online databases provided by the Erasmus University; surveys sent out to employees, and 30-minute interviews sessions conducted by me with a dozen of employees primarily from the Global Functions (GF) department, situated in the Randstad and Bangalore region.
profile_positions.title: Assessed Internship IT Global Functions

profile_positions.description:
Global Data Collection Company, GDDC, is an independent data collection company providing international telephonic fieldwork services to leading market research and consultancy agencies globally. The company is also one of the first corporate Esomar members, underscoring GDCC’s company-wide commitment to quality. GDCC is  the only data collection company who is able to conduct all 27 EU countries from one single location, using native speakers for all of the markets.

At GDCC I conduct qualitative- and quantitative market research for renowned institutions and companies such as the European Union, Onderzoeksbureau GfK, Delta Lloyd, Gallup, Dun & Bradstreet, and Liander using a Computer Automated Telephonic Interviewing (CATI) system. This is a telephone surveying technique in which the interviewer follows a script provided by a software application. The projects that I call for vary from life satisfaction surveys used by the EU and Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) to customer satisfaction surveys about the smart meter that was recently installed in households in The Randstad by network administrator Liander.
profile_positions.title: International Market Researcher

profile_positions.description:
ECE Students is with 57 committee members spread out over 13 committees the largest student-run organization on Campus Woudestein that focuses on Entrepreneurship. ECE Students stimulates Entrepreneurship amongst students by organizing events that allow them to get in touch with the business life, but also provides the necessary tools – coaching, workshops and workspace – so that ideas can be developed into early-stage start-ups. ECE Students is an initiative of the Erasmus Centre for Entrepreneurship (ECE), Rotterdam School of Management (RSM), and Erasmus School of Economics (ESE). 

As the External Relations Manager I am responsible for maintaining contact with sponsors (big corporates, SMEs and start-ups) and acquiring new business leads that contribute to the growth of ECE Students. This is a full-time position of 40+ hours per week and I am employed by the Erasmus University for a duration of 10 months. 

o	Chairman of the Acquisition Committee 
-	Managed a team of 5 people 
-       Implemented a cross-functional team structure 
-	Achieved a twofold (x2) increase in sponsorship revenue
-	Created a cold calling list of approx. 300 companies 

o	Chairman of the Study Trip Committee 
-	Managed a team of 5 people
-	Organized a Euro Trip to Vienna (Austria), Bratislava (Slovakia) and Budapest (Hungary)
-	Offered this 7-day trip to 30 students at Erasmus University for 299 euro’s 
-	Divided our activities according to three different pillars: ‘Cultural, Entrepreneurial and Social’
-	Visited some notable companies such as Google & Prezi
profile_positions.title: External Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:
CanalDigitaal is the #1 provider of digital television via satellite. More than one million Dutch people watch digital television and listen to the digital radio via CanalDigitaal. By doing so, the Dutch are assured of excellent image quality, an extensive choice of channels and sharp satellite subscription fees. 

At the headquarters of CanaalDigitaal I started off as an outbound retention agent responsible for extending the contracts of current satellite TV subscribers. I often scored in the top 10% of best performing agents. After 6 months my role and responsibilities changed. On top of my existing tasks, I started doing inbound customer service, and I was given the opportunity to train new recruits on how to retain the existing clientele. During my employment I learned numerous sales techniques, and taught the recruits about the AIDA technique and the Iceberg Method, to name a few.
profile_positions.title: Technical Helpdesk Advisor & Outbound Sales Representative

profile_positions.description:
ABT is a business to business (B2B) lead generation company that specializes in appointment setting (lead generation) for your sales department. ABT has more than 18 years of experience in the field of "appointment setting", generating qualified (new business) appointments for account managers.

At Active Business Telemarketing I worked as a financial intermediary assistant responsible for appointment setting with consumers and businesses that showed interest in switching mortgages, private loans, and revolving credits at their current bank or financial services provider, to one of the other 15 banks that ABT is partnered up with. Here I learned a lot about the business to business (B2B) and business to consumer (B2C) acquisition process. After 7 months, I was allowed to work a couple of shifts from home per week as a reward for my personal development.
profile_positions.title: Financial Intermediary Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Fourplus delivers high quality customer services, telemarketing and consultancy services. Competent people, well-defined processes and a robust IT support allows Fourplus to deliver contact center services, enable growth, improve customer satisfaction and reduce cost for a substantial amount of companies.

At FourPlus I was introduced to the world of call centres and telemarketing at the early age of 17. During my first month on the job I started off with B2C cold calling for Eon, one of the world’s largest electric utility service providers. Afterwards, I started with a B2B project for Marktplaats, the largest online marketplace in The Netherlands, where I sold advertisements to SMEs and independent contractors. As a reward for my good performance, after 4 months, I was allowed to work on an inbound project during the last hour of my shift in the evenings for 1850, a Dutch based number directory company.
profile_positions.title: Inbound- & Outbound Retention Representative

volunteer_experiences.description: During this 6-month volunteering period, I helped out with setting up Pink Ribbon Day Hilversum, an event that raises awareness and reduces the stigma of breast cancer through education on symptoms and treatment. Together with numerous volunteers, shop owners and the local VVD, we organized various activities such as an auction, a cycling tour with Leontien van Moorsel, a brunch in pink bathrobes, info sessions in the movie theatre, and various other activities.
